page.title: 02LANDSCAPE NEAR RIVER COLNE
page.content: The land is low_lying,but gently undulates down to the marshes on the edge of the river{Colne}and the {Pyefleet Channel. Pyefleet Channel}is a wide creek which dries out completely at low water. On the other side of{Pyefleet Channel}is part ofthe sea wall and marshes on {Mersea {Island.}The sea wall is a wall made of concrete but it has grass on it to keep the earth from washing away.It keeps the sea from flooding the land. The sea wall broke in 1952 but it has not broken since. The saltings get covered up every tide and then dry out.There is marsh on the side of the seawall and there is some rough grass on which cattle graze. All the land is drained and the water that has been drained off goes into a dyke. There are many adders living on the sea wall
